data.name: Simple Baseball Score Calculator
data.description:
# Baseball scoring calculator

The game of baseball is usually played over 9 innnings and each team has a turn at batting and fielding in order to try and score runs by passing through 3 bases and back to Home plate before three outs in an inning are reached.

In this kata you will be given a simplified list of 'Pitches' that will be one of the following:

* 'O': Out - The batter hit the ball and was out
* 'S': A strike
* 'F': A foul ball
* 'B': A Ball
* '1B': The batter hit the ball and advanced to first base
* '2B': The batter hit the ball and advnaced to second base
* '3B': The batter hit the ball and advanced to third base
* 'HR': The batter hit a home run and made it all the way round back to home plate and scored a run.

## Balls, strikes and foul balls
During an 'At-bat' a batter can receive upto 6 pitches (balls or strikes). As soon as the number of balls reaches 4, this batter is automatically given first base - A 'Walk'. If the number of strikes reaches 3, this batter is out.
If a 'foul ball' is picthes, this counts as a 'strike'. Unless there is already 2 strikes, in which case it's disregarded.

The ball/strike count is reset after each batter.


## Subsequent batters
Once on base, should a subsequent team mate hit the ball (1B, 2B, 3B or HR), the runner on base will advance the number of bases +1. e.g. a runner on first base will advance to 3rd base on a '1B' and score on a '2B', '3B' or 'HR'.
If a subseuqent batter gets a 'Walk' (See above), a batter one first base advances to 2nd base, if there is then also a batter on 2nd base, he advances to 3rd base. If there is also a batter on 3rd base, he scores. i.e. a batter on 2nd base with no one on 1st base will NOT advance on a walk.

Once there are 3 outs in a team, the bases are cleared and the next team takes their turn at batting. 

It is assumed that there are no double plays, foul balls or sacrifice plays.

## Input
You will receive a single array of pitches with the above outcomes.
For example:
`['1B','O','B','B','B','2B',S','B','S','S','B','B','B','B',O','HR','S','1B',O','2B','O']`

## Output
Calculate the score of the game after all the outcomes have been resolved. In the above scenario:
 - 1B: First batter reaches first base
 - O: Next batter is out. 1st batter remains on base
 - B,B,B,2B: Next batter takes three balls then hits a double and reaches second base. The first runner advances home and scores a run. 1-0
 - S,B,S,S: Next batter takes first a strike, then a ball, then two more strikes and is struck out.
 - B,B,B,B: The next batter is walked and reaches first base. The runner on 2nd base does not advance.
 - O: The next batter is out. As this is the third out, the bases are cleared and the next team bats.
 After first team's inning: 1-0
 - HR: The batter hits a home run and scores a run: 1-1
 - S,1B: The batter takes a strike and then hits a single, reaching first base.
 - O: The next batter is out.
 - 2B: The Next batter hits the ball and reaches 2nd base. The runner on first base scores 1-2
 - O: The next batter is out.
 After the second team's innning: 1-2
 
 Return an array containing exactly 2 elements with the score `[1,2]`
